    "  2.1 in  @xcite and   [ ssec : dusa ] ) .    for all non - displaceable torus fibers in these examples",
    ", we can also use our remarks to obtain an appropriate optimal lower bound for the number of transversal intersection points , which for these lagrangian @xmath72-tori is @xmath71 .",
    "[ rmk : dusa ] regarding this last example , mcduff shows in  @xcite that it gives rise , under a repeated _ wedge _ construction , to a monotone symplectic toric @xmath73-manifold with a continuous interval of lagrangian torus fibers that can not be displaced by her method of probes  @xcite . hence ,",
    "as she points out , these fibers  may perhaps be non - displaceable by hamiltonian isotopies , even though , according to  @xcite , their floer homology vanishes \" .",
    "although we can use the remarks in this paper to prove non - displaceability of the relevant torus fibers in the non - fano toric symplectic @xmath71-manifold ( cf .",
    "  [ ssec : dusa ] ) , so far we have not been able to do the same for the corresponding monotone toric symplectic @xmath73-manifold .",
    "we thank matthew strom borman , cheol - hyun cho , rui loja fernandes , dusa mcduff and chris woodward , for several useful discussions regarding this paper .",
    "we thank impa and ist for the warm hospitality during the preparation of this work .",
    "part of these results were first presented by the first author at the workshop on symplectic geometry and topology , kyoto university , japan , february 1418 , 2011 .",
    "he thanks the organizers , kenji fukaya and kaoru ono , for the opportunity to participate in such a wonderful event .",
    "this first remark , on cartesian products , is motivated by alston s result in part ( iii ) of theorem  [ thm : basic ] and can be used to remove its dimension restriction , i.e. prove theorem  [ thm : even ] .",
    "we will also use it in combination with our second remark , on symplectic reduction .",

    "@xmath85    [ defn : hf0 ] the floer invariant @xmath86 of an even integral polytope @xmath3 is defined by @xmath87    [ prop : kunneth ] if @xmath88 , with @xmath89 and @xmath90 even integral polytopes , then @xmath91    suppose @xmath92 and @xmath93 have normal vectors @xmath94 then @xmath95 , @xmath96 , has normal vectors @xmath97 hence , the linear map @xmath98 on @xmath99 is given by @xmath100 the result of the proposition follows by a standard application of the knneth formula in this context .",
    "using this proposition and the fact that @xmath101 always has an even number of facets , we can define the floer invariant of any integral polytope .",
    "[ defn : hf ] the floer invariant @xmath86 of an integral polytope @xmath3 is defined by @xmath102      suppose now that @xmath3 is a fano delzant polytope and let @xmath103 denote its associated smooth fano toric variety .",

    "assuming that the lagrangian floer homology @xmath110 is well defined , we have the following theorem .",
    "[ thm : main ] @xmath111    [ cor : main ] @xmath112    if @xmath3 is a fano delzant polytope , then @xmath113 is an even fano delzant polytope to which theorem  [ thm : main ] applies .",
    "suppose that @xmath114 then @xmath115 would be such that @xmath116 = \\left(\\sharp ( \\psi(r_p ) \\,\\cap\\ , t_p ) \\right)^2 <   ( hf(p))^2 = hf ( p\\times p)\\,,\\ ] ] which would imply that @xmath117 this contradicts theorem  [ thm : main ] . as before , we are assuming that @xmath118 is well defined .",
    "the meaning of @xmath110 being well defined depends on the technical tools one is willing to use . if one uses only a basic version of lagrangian floer homology , then the condition that the minimal maslov number of @xmath107 is bigger than two has to be enforced . under this assumption , it can be proved as in @xcite that , for the standard complex structure @xmath119 on @xmath103 , the boundary of the moduli space of holomorphic strips with dimension one is given by broken strips and holomorphic disks with maslov index two and boundary in @xmath108 .",
    "moreover , the linearized cauchy - riemann operator @xmath120 is surjective for all @xmath119-holomorphic strips @xmath121 of maslov index one or two .",
    "it follows from this that @xmath110 is well defined whenever @xmath8 is even . as a matter of fact ,",
    "if @xmath8 is even then the holomorphic disks with index two and boundary in @xmath108 counted by @xmath122 cancel out when we work with @xmath77 coefficients ; this is the key point in the proof of proposition [ prop : square ] . in particular , @xmath118 is well defined whatever is the parity of @xmath8 .",
    "indeed , the minimal maslov number of @xmath123 equals the minimal maslov number of @xmath107 .    with this hypothesis on @xmath107",
    "the set of examples that are covered by corollary  [ cor : main ] is a bit restrictive .",
    "if one uses a sophisticated version of lagrangian floer homology , such as the one developed by fukaya , oh , ohta and ono in  @xcite , then corollary  [ cor : main ] covers a lot more ground ( see  @xcite ) .",
    "[ rmk : even ] even with only basic lagrangian floer homology , @xmath118 is indeed well defined when @xmath3 is a simplex , i.e. @xmath124 , and corollary  [ cor : main ] can be combined with a combinatorial computation of @xmath125 to prove theorem  [ thm : even ] , hence removing the dimension restriction of alston s result .",
    "we will not present that combinatorial computation here since ( i ) it is presented in  @xcite and ( ii ) , as we will see , our remark on symplectic reduction can also be used to easily remove this restriction .",
    "the proof of theorem  [ thm : main ] is a simple combination of the following two ingredients :    * the characterization by cho  @xcite and cho - oh  @xcite of the holomorphic discs on fano toric manifolds , that are relevant for the differential on the lagrangiam floer complex , as blaschke products ; * the existence of _ global homogeneous coordinates _ on any smooth toric variety @xmath103 , not just on @xmath126 ( see  4.4 of cox  @xcite ) .",
    "we will now discuss some details of ( ii ) , and how they contribute to the proof of theorem  [ thm : main ] .    from the well known quotient representation",
    "@xmath127 we get a map @xmath128 \\notag\\end{aligned}\\ ] ] defining homogeneous coordinates on @xmath103 , where homogeneous here is with respect to the action of the torus @xmath129 .",

    "standard equivariant neighborhood theorems in symplectic geometry imply that a sufficiently small neighborhood @xmath262 of each of these isotropic tori is @xmath203-equivariantly symplectomorphic to @xmath263 , where @xmath264 is a neighborhood of the origin , @xmath265 is a neighborhood of the @xmath266-section , and @xmath267 are the usual symplectic forms on @xmath268 and @xmath269 respectively .",

    "if @xmath283 for any @xmath225 then @xmath284    this idea of using symplectic reduction to prove intersection properties of lagrangian submanifolds was used by tamarkin in  @xcite .",
    "it is also present in the work of borman  @xcite on reduction properties of quasi - morphisms and quasi - states ( see also  @xcite ) .",
    "recall that any symplectic toric manifold @xmath33 can be constructed as a symplectic reduction of @xmath285 where @xmath8 is the number of facets of the corresponding polytope @xmath30 .",
    "this reduction is with respect to the natural action of a subtorus @xmath286 of dimension @xmath287 , whose lie algebra @xmath288 is determined as the kernel of the linear map @xmath289 where @xmath290 is the canonical basis of @xmath291 and @xmath292 are the primitive integral interior normals to the facets of the moment polytope @xmath3 .",
    "when @xmath293 , correspondng to a splitting @xmath294 , recall that the principle of reduction in stages tells us that , at appropriate level sets , reduction with respect to the action of @xmath295 is equivalent to    * first reducing with respect to @xmath296 , obtaining a symplectic manifold @xmath297 with hamiltonian action of @xmath298 , * then reducing @xmath297 with respect to @xmath299 .",
    "this principle will be used repeatedly in the applications considered in the next sections .",
    "it is also the main ingredient in the proof of the following proposition , which in turn will be used in the proof of theorem  [ thm : monotone ] ( cf .",
    "proposition  [ prop : monotone ] in   [ ssec : monotone ] ) .",
    "[ prop : factor ] let @xmath33 be a symplectic toric manifold and @xmath46 the primitive integral interior normals to the facets of its moment polytope @xmath30 .",
    "let @xmath300 be such that @xmath301 then @xmath0 can be obtained as a symplectic reduction of the weighted projective space @xmath302 .",
    "@xmath33 can be obtained as the symplectic reduction of @xmath303 by the action of a subtorus @xmath295 with @xmath304 , where the linear map @xmath305 is given by  ( [ eq : beta ] ) .",
    "this means in particular that @xmath306 which together with  ( [ eq : weighted ] ) implies that @xmath203 can be written as @xmath307 with @xmath308 .",
    "since the weighted projective space @xmath302 is obtained as the symplectic reduction of @xmath303 by the action of @xmath309 , one can use the principle of reduction in stages to conclude the proof .",
    "we will use the following results stated in theorem  [ thm : basic ] :    * the clifford torus @xmath310 is non - displaceable and @xmath311  @xcite . *",
    "the pair @xmath312 is non - displaceable in @xmath313 and @xmath314 for any @xmath315  @xcite .",
    "[ defn : centred ] recall from example  [ ex : monotone ] that any monotone toric symplectic manifold has a unique monotone torus fiber , called the centered or special torus fiber , which is the lagrangian torus orbit over the `` center '' of its moment polytope",
    ". a symplectic reduction of a monotone toric symplectic manifold at a level containing its centered torus fiber , i.e. through the special `` center '' of its moment polytope , will be called a _ centered _ symplectic reduction .",
    "one can easily extend alston s result to @xmath316 .",
    "in fact , @xmath316 can be obtained as a centered symplectic reduction of @xmath317 ( cf .",
    "figure  [ fig:1 ] for the @xmath318 case ) and we get that @xmath319 note that the fact that this estimate is known to be optimal for @xmath320 implies that alston s bound for @xmath321 is also optimal .     as reduction of @xmath321 . ]",
    "let @xmath33 be a monotone toric manifold , @xmath12 its real part and @xmath45 its special centered torus fiber .",
    "let @xmath46 denote the primitive integral interior normals to the facets of the moment polytope of @xmath13 .",
    "[ prop : zero - sum ] if @xmath48 then @xmath45 and the pair @xmath322 are non - displaceable . moreover ,",
    "@xmath323    proposition  [ prop : factor ] and the zero - sum condition on the normals imply that the standard symplectic reduction construction of @xmath13 from @xmath324 factors through @xmath325 .",
    "the monotone condition implies that this is a centered symplectic reduction and we can apply corollary  [ cor : displace ] .",
    "the monotone @xmath53 , i.e. the monotone blow - up of @xmath320 at three points , fits the context of application 2 and can be obtained as a centered symplectic reduction of @xmath326 .",
    "this means that @xmath327 it can also be obtained as a centered symplectic reduction of @xmath328 .",
    "since our floer combinatorial invariant of @xmath328 is @xmath71 , this gives the same bound : @xmath329 however , if one sees @xmath13 as a centered symplectic reduction of @xmath330 , cf .",
    "figure  [ fig:2 ] , one improves the bound to @xmath331 which is optimal and coincides with the value of the floer combinatorial invariant of the hexagon .     as reduction of @xmath330 . ]",
    "let us describe the details of this reduction construction .",
    "the cube at the left of figure  [ fig:2 ] , corresponding to the moment polytope of a monotone @xmath330 , can be described by the following inequalites : @xmath332 the monotone @xmath333 can be obtained from this toric manifold by centered symplectic reduction with respect to the circle @xmath334 determined by the lie algebra vector @xmath335 , at level @xmath336 .",
    "the quotient @xmath72-torus @xmath337 acts on the reduced manifold and , with respect to its lie algebra basis given by @xmath338 , the resulting moment polytope is described by the above inequalities with @xmath339 , i.e. the hexagon at the right of figure  [ fig:2 ] .",
    "in fact , the monotone @xmath333 is just a particular case of the following more general proposition .",
    "[ prop : sym ] let @xmath33 be a monotone toric manifold , @xmath12 its real part and @xmath45 its special centered torus fiber .",
    "suppose that the corresponding moment polytope @xmath340 is _ symmetric _ , i.e. if @xmath50 is the interior normal to a facet of @xmath3 then @xmath165 is also the interior normal to a facet of @xmath3",

    "the fact that @xmath13 is monotone implies that all the @xmath342 s have the same area and that this is a centered symplectic reduction .",
    "hence , we get from corolary  [ cor : displace ] that @xmath344 since @xmath345 the bound is indeed optimal .",
    "let @xmath33 be a compact monotone symplectic toric manifold and @xmath45 its special centered torus fiber .",
    "denote by @xmath346 the primitive integral interior normals to the facets of its delzant polytope @xmath47 .",
    "[ lem : monotone ] there exists @xmath347 such that @xmath348 with all @xmath349 .",
    "since @xmath3 is the moment polytope of a compact toric manifold , the support of its associated fan is the whole @xmath350 . in particular",
    ", every lattice vector @xmath50 belongs to a cone of the fan determined by some vertex of @xmath3 , which means that it can be written as a non - negative integral linear combination of the primitive integral interior normals to the @xmath351 facets that meet at that vertex .",
    "the lemma follows by taking @xmath352    [ prop : monotone ] on any compact monotone toric symplectic manifold @xmath64 the special centered lagrangian torus fiber @xmath45 is non - displaceable .",
    "moreover , @xmath323    using the previous lemma , and after a possible re - ordering of the normals , we can assume that @xmath353 this condition and proposition  [ prop : factor ] imply that the standard symplectic reduction construction of @xmath13 from @xmath324 factors through the weighted projective space @xmath354 .",

    "note that the monotone case with just one non - displaceable torus fiber over the special central point can be obtained as a limit of any of these .",
    "a very similar idea applies to @xmath374 , i.e. the equal blow - up of @xmath320 at two points which can also be thought of as the blow - up of @xmath375 at one point .",
    "one recovers the results of fukaya - oh - ohta - ono  @xcite and woodward  @xcite illustrated in figures  [ fig:6 ] and  [ fig:7 ] .",

    ", one thinks of @xmath13 as a symplectic reduction of @xmath376 , with  big \" @xmath320 , to show that the torus fiber over the origin is non - displaceable . on the right",

    ", one thinks of @xmath13 as a symplectic reduction of @xmath376 , with  small \" @xmath320 and large @xmath342 s , to show that a torus fiber  close \" to the origin is non - displaceable . on the right",

    "we will use the same idea to understand an example fukaya , oh , ohta and ono  @xcite , presented in figure  [ fig:8 ] ( see example 10.3 in  @xcite ) .",
    "the symplectic manifold is @xmath68 with blow - ups of different sizes , one smaller than monotone and the other bigger than monotone , and they obtain a closed interval of non - displaceable torus fibers .",
    "this can also be obtained by considering @xmath13 as the symplectic reduction of @xmath381 ( or the compact @xmath382 ) as shown in figure  [ fig:8 ] .     as reduction of @xmath381 . ]",
    "the details are as follows .",
    "consider @xmath383 given by the delzant polytope @xmath384 determined by the following inequalities : @xmath385 the non - displaceable torus fibers are over the points with coordinates @xmath386 for @xmath387 ( figure  [ fig:8 ] corresponds to @xmath388 ) .",

    "the one for the first @xmath395 factor is given by the inequalities @xmath396 having a non - displaceable torus fiber over the point with coordinate @xmath397 . * the one for the second @xmath395 factor is given by the inequalities @xmath398 having a non - displaceable torus fiber over the point with coordinate @xmath399 .",
    "we can now do symplectic reduction with respect to the @xmath72-torus @xmath400 determined by the lie algebra vectors @xmath401 at the level given by @xmath402 to obtain the polytope @xmath403 with non - displaceable torus fiber over the point with coordinates @xmath404 and @xmath405 .",
    "one can use the same idea to understand non - displaceable torus fibers on @xmath53 for all possible sizes of blown - up points .",
    "figure  [ fig:9 ] illustrates the case of three small size blow - ups , where one gets four non - displaceable torus fibers .    .",

    "note that we can also get a closed interval of non - displaceable torus fibers for @xmath53 , e.g. by blowing up the example in application 6 at the lower right corner of figure  [ fig:8 ] .",
    "here we will use the basic non - displaceability result for the central torus fiber of a weighted projective space stated in theorem  [ thm : weighted ] and show how it implies non - displaceability of at least one torus fiber on any hirzebruch surface , a result of fukaya - oh - ohta - ono  @xcite ( see example 10.1 in  @xcite ) , and a continuous interval of non - displaceable torus fibers on a particular non - fano toric surface considered by mcduff  @xcite .      consider the weighted projective space @xmath408 , the symplectic quotient of @xmath409 by the @xmath59-action with weights @xmath410 , with moment polytope @xmath411 given by @xmath412 the special torus sitting over the origin is non - displaceable .",
    "figure  [ fig:11 ] illustrates the @xmath413 case .",
    "now let @xmath69 be a hirzebruch surface , with @xmath70 .",
    "each of these hirzebruch surfaces can be seen as a centered symplectic reduction of @xmath414 and that implies at least one non - displaceable torus fiber on any @xmath415 .",
    "figure  [ fig:12 ] illustrates the @xmath413 case .",
    "consider the delzant polytope @xmath356 determined by the following inequalities : @xmath417 the torus fibers over the points with coordinates @xmath418 and @xmath419 , with @xmath420 , are non - displaceable by probes .",
    "we can show that all these fibers are in fact non - displaceable by considering this toric @xmath71-manifold as a symplectic reduction of @xmath421 , as shown in figure  [ fig:13 ] ( where @xmath422 ) .",
    "* the one for the @xmath423 factor is given by the inequalities @xmath424 having a non - displaceable torus fiber over the point with coordinates @xmath418 and @xmath419 . *",
    "the one for the @xmath395 factor is given by the inequalities @xmath425 having a non - displaceable torus fiber over the point with coordinate @xmath426 . * the one for the @xmath391 factor is given by the inequalities @xmath427 having a non - displaceable torus fiber over the point with coordinate @xmath428 and @xmath429 .",
    "we can now do symplectic reduction with respect to the @xmath173-torus @xmath430 determined by the lie algebra vectors @xmath431 at the level given by @xmath432 to obtain the polytope @xmath3 with non - displaceable torus fiber over the point with coordinates @xmath433 and @xmath419 ."
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> we consider two natural lagrangian intersection problems in the context of symplectic toric manifolds : displaceability of torus orbits and of a torus orbit with the real part of the toric manifold . </S>",
    "<S> our remarks address the fact that one can use simple cartesian product and symplectic reduction considerations to go from basic examples to much more sophisticated ones . </S>",
    "<S> we show in particular how rigidity results for the above lagrangian intersection problems in weighted projective spaces can be combined with these considerations to prove analogous results for all monotone toric symplectic manifolds . </S>",
    "<S> we also discuss non - monotone and/or non - fano examples , including some with a continuum of non - displaceable torus orbits . </S>"
  ]
}
